Hmm,

JAVA_HOME was set because I have a NFS shared home drive which is the=
  
same on all the machines.

Definitely NO java though (not even some bodg=
ed gcj based one)

Oh well - if the problem is just local to my specific se=
tup I doubt  
it is worth worrying about :-)

worked fine once I had put Ja=
va on of course...

cheers

mark


On 23 Aug 2006, at 15:11, bert.wendland@=
bnf.fr wrote:

>
> Hi Mark,
>
> The start script of heritrix already contai=
ns exactly the feature  
> that you are requesting. It performs two tests. =
First, it looks if  
> the environment variable JAVA_HOME is set (to find o=
ut yourself,  
> type 'echo $JAVA_HOME'). In case if not, the script looks =
for a  
> 'java' executable in the search path (type 'which java'). If both=
  
> tests fail, the script exits saying 'Cannot find JAVA. Please set  
> =
JAVA_HOME or your PATH'.
>
> So I guess you either have a java installation=
 which doesn't work  
> correctly anymore or java has been incompletely dei=
nstalled or  
> heritrix has a problem to run under the given environment o=
f that  
> machine. Also keep in mind that heritrix needs java version 1.5.=
0+.
>
> So long,
>   Bert
>
>
>
>
>
> Message de : mark <mark@...=
>

er@yahoogroups.com

>
> Hi,
>
> I have been using Heritirx on =
a lots of different machine recently
> and one thing that drives me mad is =
if java is not installed on a
> machine it just sits there printing "."'s r=
ather than telling you
> there is no Java. I am not a shell script expert b=
ut if some one
> could add a "please install java" that would be nice (or j=
ust fail if
> it can't run it).
>
> I know this happens almost never (excep=
t to me) but Heritrix is
> reaching 1.10 soon and it would add to the all r=
ound quality we see
> in other areas of the application :-)
>
> cheers
>
> =
mark
